name: Jerk-Seasoned Air-Fryer Potatoes
description: As a spicy food lover, this is a simple way to enjoy the Jamaican jerk flavor profile in a meatless side dish. It also works really well with any store-bought Thai curry paste. — Ben Costantino, Astoria, New York
recipeIngredient: 1 pound baby Yukon Gold potatoes, quartered
1 Scotch bonnet pepper, seeded and minced, optional

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat air fryer to 360°. In a large saucepan, bring 8 cups water to a boil. Add potatoes; cook, uncovered, just until water returns to a boil, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a spice grinder, or with a mortar and pestle, combine thyme, garlic, pepper, salt, allspice and, if desired, Scotch bonnet pepper; grind to a paste.

Drain potatoes and pat dry. Transfer to a large bowl. Drizzle with oil; toss to coat. Stir in paste until potatoes are well coated. Place potatoes on greased tray in air-fryer basket. Cook for 8 minutes, shaking basket once. Increase temperature to 375°. Cook until fork-tender and crispy, 5-6 minutes longer, shaking basket once.

review.reviewBody: I loved this recipe and so did my husband.
